<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Stitch Flesh](/Feats.aspx?ID=3495) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 45</row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9)

</column>

---

You can use [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57) to restore Hit Points to [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creatures, not just living ones. The techniques you use to do so vary, but all require sutures, bandages, and other tools included in [healer's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=25). Some conditions that might raise the DC of treating undead's wounds differ from that of living creatures. For instance, the GM might increase the DC if the undead being treated is in a church of [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=14) or the wounds were caused by powerful positive energy.
name: Stitch Flesh
